fields.summary: Current merge algorithm does not seem to present a conflict when one is expected in some cases
Pasting email links containing upper-case (capital) letters does not autoformat correctly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23482].
  {panel}

On chrome:
1. Create a new page
2. Insert a horizontal rule as the first thing on the page
3. Press enter
Another HR is created every time you press enter. You can delete all of them except the first one which cannot be deleted.

On firefox:
1. Create a new page
2. Insert a horizontal rule as the first thing on the page
3. Press delete to try to delete the HR. You can't
4. Now press enter. Every time you press enter a new HR is created.

Other browsers have similar issues.
fields.summary: When you create a horizontal rule as the first thing on a page, more horizontal rules will be added after pressing enter

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: # create a new page # CMD + B, then type some text and press enter (the "bold" style should carry to the new line created) # press the "bullet" toolbar button to insert a bullet item # start typing some text. *The text will be normal unbolded text!*. This is because for some reason the editor is *not* putting the text in the strong tag for some reason. This is what the bullet item markup looks like: {code}
  • foo
{code} Notice the text "foo" is outside the STRONG tags. What the?!?!?!?!? # if you now delete the text inside the bullet you are left with a bullet that: #- cannot be cursor-ed into using the direction keys (but you can use your mouse to position the cursor inside). The reason why you can't cursor into it because
    • does not have a
    in it. #- cannot be deleted using backspace (as there is a inside it preventing it from being deleted) See video for more details h4. Root cause When you hit enter and carry a style format to the next line, the second paragraph looks like this before the bullet point is inserted: {code}

    first paragraph


    {code} When the user now hits the bullet toolbar button (or uses autoformat or uses the CMD + SHIFT + B shortcut) you get: {code}

    first paragraph

    CURSOR-IS-HERE!!!!

    {code} Notice two things: # the cursor is outside of the strong tags # the strong tags don't have a BR tag inside it which is crucial to allow the cursor to be placed inside. This is the root cause and everything goes downhill from here. We need to revise the code that creates a bullet item and ensure it handles the situation where there is some "styling" that is applicable to the current cursor position.

fields.summary: Merging changes can incorrectly throw an overwrite / discard prompt when two users are editing two different nodes

fields.description:
Start with the following bullet list
* Point 1
* Point 2

User A edits the page and adds an extra point
* Point 1
* Point 2
* Point 3

Before User A can save, User B edits the page and moves the initial two points into a table
||Point Name|| Point notes ||
| Point 1 | First point |
| Point 2 | Second point |

User A saves
User B saves

Expected: User B presented with overwrite / discard prompt
Actual: Changes are merged which results in the third point becoming orphaned thus

||Point Name|| Point notes ||
| Point 1 | First point |
| Point 2 | Second point |

* Point 3

While this looks reasonably harmless, if the move was between different points on the page with bodies of text in between, the attempted merge would be an untidy experience
fields.summary: No overwrite / discard prompt when one user adds an extra item to a bullet list while another user adds the original bullets to a table

fields.description:
Originally reported in CONFDEV-2220

One way to reproduce this:
1. edit a page with 2 headings on separate lines
2. select the text in the 2 headings
3. click remove formatting
4. press the undo keyboard shortcut cmd+z

Nothing happens. Instead the selection changes. If you press cmd+z one more time it works. Strangely the undo button on the toolbar works the first time.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23463].
  {panel}

Inserting pictures into a newly created page, then changing the page location to another space will create a bug were the images are lost and display an 'unknown attachment' label in place of the images.

to replicate:
1) create new page in a space
2) insert some images
3) wait to page is auto-saved
4) change the location to another space
5) select 'save'
6) open up the space and navigate to the newly created page.

fields.description:
When a page is redirecting to an admin-restricted screen, {{authenticate.action}} may intercept the request and prompt for a password. When a valid password is supplied, the browser is redirected to the intended destination.  If the intended destination includes a fragment tag in the URL ({{#here}}), the fragment tag isn't propagated in the redirect.

My scenario was trying to redirect from a plugin configuration screen to another admin screen ({{/plugins/servlet/upm#manage/plugin.key.here}}).  This URL works some of the time, but only when {{authenticate.action}} doesn't intercept.
fields.summary: authenticate.action redirect does not propagate HTML fragment tag

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23461].
  {panel}

Some examples:

* backspacing past the beginning of a line in the code macro deletes the entire previous line
* backspacing in an inline formatted block (e.g. bold/hyperlink) will sometimes delete the entire element

When a user I'm following deletes a space I get an email for every single attachment they removed.
This is causing extra work for a process that's already too slow.  And it's causing me to get a lot of email I don't want.

This is only a problem for network-based notifications.  I assume Space/Content watches are deleted before anything else happens.

Hide the space before removing it.   *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23442].
  {panel}

It would help space administrators to have a central location for managing all the comments in a space. This could be a new tab under "Browse Space", as suggested in CONF-5704. Or it could be some other mechanism.

The page would include comments on pages and on blog posts.

The space administrator would want to:
* See a summary of each comment. (Author, first line.)
* Expand a comment inline.
* Remove a comment.
* Respond to a comment inline.
* Mark a number of comments, then remove them all at once.
* Sort comments by date. Default sort order is by date, with the most recent at the top.
* Maybe sort comments by author.
* Maybe sort comments by page.

As an example, see the comment management page in WordPress. Screenshot attached.

*Note:*
A number of the points above are covered by related feature requests. We will use this issue to track the general request of grouping the comment admin in one screen. (For example, *Space Admin > Manage Comments*.)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23437].
  {panel}

Dear Technical Writer Team,

Most of our users would install Confluence in Windows through the installer as described in [this doc|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Installing+Confluence+on+Windows]. All the <confluence-install> and <confluence-home> directory, by default, would be located under {{C:\Program Files\Atlassian}} which is normally a restricted directory in recent Windows (ie. Windows Server 2008). Hence it'd be nice if there is a clear indication which directory and which permission needs to be given to the which user. This would avoid any confusion for new users, especially this is related to security issue. We actually do have [this page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Creating+a+Dedicated+User+Account+on+the+Operating+System+to+Run+Confluence], specifies which directory needs to be given write permission. I think we can add some examples of the location for the Windows user to know which is which should be given - eg. some users doesn't know where are their Confluence Home Directory after installing using the installer wizard.

Purpose here is to avoid confusion for new end-users in setting up Confluence since a mistake in this part would fail the installation completely.

Much thanks,
Husein
fields.summary: Clarify file system permissions needed for a Windows user when installing Confluence through the installer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23429].
  {panel}

Having a Confluence 3.5.x or 4.x, when you have a LDAP user directory configured. If Confluence has a user common to both internal directory and LDAP directory, depending on the order of directories, when the user login, he will use the groups and memberships of the directory being used at the moment. (The one which is above the other in the order).

Here is a example:
* User Alfred is member of Confluence-users, Confluence-administrators and Tech space group in the internal directory

Meanwhile
* User Alfred is member only of Confluence-users and confluence-administrators in LDAP

Once the LDAP directory is placed above the internal directory, when the user login, he will be "removed" from the membership of the group Tech space, 

However, if he login again while the internal directory is placed above the LDAP directory, he will have all permissions of the internal directory. This happens also of the other hand, when the user has groups memberships in LDAP and it's not carried over when he login using the internal directory.

Confluence should merge membership of common users being used in all directories configured in Confluence, so permissions won't be lost
fields.summary: Confluence should not "drop" group memberships for users when you change user directories orders

When using the JIRA Issues macro's "Create New Issue" function, only the system fields are provided in the form. There are situations where the field configuration used in JIRA has some fields/customfields which are required and because these fields are not filled in the macro, issue creation will fail with a warning. 
Here are basic support fields:

System fields:
- Component
- Fix Versions
- Affect Versions
- Priority
- Due date
- Environment
- Assignee
- Reporter
- Labels

Custom fields 
- Textfield, textarea, URL, number (ie Epic name)

See screenshot for example.
!screenshot-1.jpg!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23413].
  {panel}

The [Confluence Notation Guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/renderer/notationhelp.action?section=all] explains how to link to an anchor:

|| Notation || Comment ||
| \[\#anchor\]
\[^attachment.ext\]
or
\[pagetitle\]
\[pagetitle\#anchor\]
\[pagetitle^attachment.ext\]
or
\[spacekey:pagetitle\]
\[spacekey:pagetitle\#anchor\]
\[spacekey:pagetitle^attachment.ext\] | Creates an internal hyperlink to the specified page in the desired space (or the current one if you don't specify any space). Appending the optional '\#' sign followed by an anchor name will lead into a specific bookmarked point of the desired page. Also having the optional '^' followed by the name of an attachment will lead into a link to the attachment of the desired page.
Example: pagetitle
\\ \\
If such a page doesn't already exist, it will allow you to create the page in the current space. Create page links will have a  after them.
\\ \\
Example: anewpage |

...but not how to create an anchor.

The [Jira Notation Guide|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all] seems to do it nicely:


|| Notation || Comment ||
| \[\#anchor\]
\[^attachment.ext\] | Creates an internal hyperlink to the specified anchor or attachment. Appending the '#' sign followed by an anchor name will lead into a specific bookmarked point of the desired page. Having the '^' followed by the name of an attachment will lead into a link to the attachment of the current issue. | 
| ... | ... |
| \{anchor:anchorname\} | Creates a bookmark anchor inside the page. You can then create links directly to that anchor. So the link [My Page#here] will link to wherever in "My Page" there is an {anchor:here} macro, and the link [#there] will link to wherever in the current page there is an {anchor:there} macro. |

\\

*So could the Confluence Notation Guide be updated to reflect the above please?*
fields.summary: Add information to the Notation Guide - How to create an anchor on a page

This improvement will permit:

fields.description:
As a system admin for confluence, I created a simple user macro for testing purposes, which outputs the {{$remoteUser}}, {{$action.remoteUser}}, and {{$req.getRemoteUser()}} (just to see what each results in). {noformat:borderStyle=dotted|title=userMacro} ## @noparams $remoteUser $action.remoteUser $req.getRemoteUser() {noformat} When added to a page (within my personal space), all display the logged in user when viewed within confluence. When using the XML-RPC API, however, I only see the text '$remoteUser', $action.remoteUser' etc within {{
(STUFF SHOWS HERE)
}}. The remote call is done using the following Confluence XML-RPC API calls in python: {noformat:borderStyle=dashed|title=user_listing.py} #!/usr/bin/python import xmlrpclib import getpass import sys CONFLUENCE_URL='https://example.confluence.com/rpc/xmlrpc' CONFLUENCE_LOGIN='admin' CONFLUENCE_PASSWORD='PASSWORD' SPACE_TOKEN="~personal_space_token" PAGE_NAME="userlisting" client = xmlrpclib.Server(CONFLUENCE_URL,verbose=0) authToken=client.confluence1.login(CONFLUENCE_LOGIN,CONFLUENCE_PASSWORD) pageObject=client.confluence1.getPage(authToken,SPACE_TOKEN,PAGE_NAME) renderedPage=client.confluence1.renderContent(authToken,SPACE_TOKEN,pageObject['id'],'',{'style':'clean'}) print renderedPage client.confluence1.logout(authToken) {noformat} and, in ruby just to make sure it wasn't anything weird in python: {noformat:borderStyle=dashed|title=user_listing.rb} #!/usr/bin/ruby require 'xmlrpc/client' CONFLUENCE_URL = 'https://example.confluence.edu/rpc/xmlrpc' CONFLUENCE_LOGIN = 'admin' CONFLUENCE_PASSWORD = 'PASSWORD' SPACE_TOKEN = "~personal_space_token" PAGE_NAME = "userlisting" client = XMLRPC::Client.new_from_uri(CONFLUENCE_URL).proxy("confluence1") # hackity hack hack client.instance_variable_get("@server").instance_variable_get("@http").verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE token = client.login(CONFLUENCE_LOGIN, CONFLUENCE_PASSWORD) page = client.getPage(token,SPACE_KEY,PAGE_NAME) rendered = client.renderContent(token,SPACE_KEY,page['id'],'', {"style" => "clean"}) puts rendered client.logout(token) {noformat} The user I log in as through the XML-RPC API is a core Confluence configured user (admin user), whereas all other users in the system are retrieved through LDAP. Not sure if this matters. I am not sure if this is an expected behavior, in which case is there any way of displaying the user from the XML-RPC API through a custom user macro?
fields.summary: Unable to access $remoteUser or $action.remoteUser in a macro through XML-RPC API

We are setting up a (public) knowledge base for our company products on top of Confluence, and we would like to (automatically) assign an identifier for each KB article that based on this identifiers, users will be able:

directly go to the article by a fixed, well-known url
search the article in the search engine (if they do not know the URI structure).
We found that each page as a tinyURL identifier, and a pageId, but we just can't find the pages through the search engine by looking up these identifiers.

followed by [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-69206]

This has been found in a Studio blitz test for the Confluence 4.0 integration, see [JSTDEV-818|https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-818].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23394].
  {panel}

Add the ability to control whether the session should be flushed, by adding a check against the {{FlushMode}} of the session.
For requests that perform read-only operations (such as Session.get() and Session.find()) against the database, flushing is unnecessary.

Flushing does a dirty check against all objects attached to the session and attempts a synchronization with the database if necessary.
This can be potentially very expensive as more objects are loaded into the session. It can also cause hibernate to
acquire locks on the database for objects attached to the session that the client had absolutely no intention to change.
fields.summary: Allow ability to disable flushing of the session invoked by the session in view filter

fields.description:
We're using a space that was imported from another Confluence Instance.  It contains various broken links that point to pages in other spaces which existed in the old wiki but do not exist in the new one. 
* In the editor these links cannot be edited.  The property panel does not even appear.
* In view you can't tell where these links point.
* In the editor and the source view you can only tell what the links point to by viewing html source or using Inspect Element
fields.summary: Cannot edit a broken (unresolved) link

fields.description:
The 'shortcut links' functionality has changed in 4.0 but the confluence administration page to control it (and explain it's usage) has not.  Yes, you can still use the [term@site] wikimarkup but how you enter it into a page has changed and the screen within the admin section should reflect that.

Previously, you could type '[term@site]' directly into the page and the linking would occur (assuming you made a shortcut link for 'site' in confluence admin).  You can still use this wikimarkup to create a link for a page but the steps have change and are as follows.

While editing a page within confluence...
1. type '['
2. select 'insert web link' from the popup
3. select 'advanced' in the 'insert link' window which has just appeared
4. enter [term@site] into the 'link' field (assuming 'site' has been defined in the shortcut links section of confluence administration, if not it errors out)
5. click 'insert'
fields.summary: The 'shortcut links' function in 4.0 has changed but the screen to manage them in confluence admin has not
Panel title is not centered if space is using Documentation theme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23387].
  {panel}

As a confluence-administrator I am able to remove restrictions in the "Restricted Pages" tab in any space-admin-area.

Whenever I need to admin-edit a page with edit restrictions, I'll have to remove all restrictions (i.e. allowing public edit!) in there.
After editing the page, I'll need to restore the old page restrictions.

It would be nice to allow admins to add themselves to the list. With that feature an admin would no longer be required to remove all restrictions of a page in order to edit that page.

See also the support ticket: CSP-69282
fields.summary: Allow to add permissions in SpaceAdmin->RestrictedPages

fields.description:
On a Confluence instance with a non-empty context path, the macro displays an error when shown in the macro browser preview.
This only happens in dynamic mode.
If you check in firebug (or equivalent), the server usually returns a 400 response.

This is because in Confluence 4.0 the macro preview request was changed from an XWork action to a REST request, and the Jira Issues Macro retrieves the baseurl for its own Issue Retriever service from the ServletActionContext provided by the XWork framework.
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro gives an error in the macro browser preview

fields.description: On page load isPageRecentlyUpdatedForUser() is called but the info isn't cached. For pages with a large number of child pages this results in a separate database call each time the page loads.
fields.summary: UserLoginInfo is not cached

fields.description:

fields.description:
For some pages (seen this twice already) editor doesn;t display bottom of the page. It is covered with the area with Preview/Save/etc buttons and you can't scroll down to see whole content. You can get there using cursor keys and even madify something.
Tried in 3 browsers and all of them affected - Chrome, IE, Firefox.
fields.summary: Can't see bottom of some pages in editor

fields.description: When I attempt to upload an attachment from my file system and the attachment's file name has an ampersand '&' character in it, a browser dialog box appears asking me whether I'd like to open or save 'attachfile.action' (see the screenshot I've included).
fields.summary: Browser Prompt to Save or Open 'attachfile.action' When Attaching a File With an Ampersand in the File Name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23378].
  {panel}

Code Macro deletes url from xml code
These are the steps to reproduce it:
1. Create new wiki document
2. Switch to "Wiki Markup" tab
3. Enter this code:
\{code:xml\}
<test>http://example.com</test>
\{code\}
4. Switch to "Preview" tab
You will see this:
<test></test>
instead of this:
<test>http://example.com</test>
fields.summary: Code Macro deletes url from xml code

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23377]. {panel} Here is the reproduction procedure: # Create a new page and fill some text with the title and the body. # Open the "Insert link" popup window and go to the "Web link" table. # Enter the following link then click on the "Insert" button to save the change. # Save the page. *Consequence*: When open the page, even the text had been converted to a link, but it is not able to click on it. *Analysis*: Regarding to the page source code, I found that: -- with the link that we've reproduce the issue:

http://XXXXXXXXX/object/objects.aspx?&ot=action&_max=*&_statusx=openclosed&itemtype==CHANGE

-- with a simple web site like www.google.com, we have:

http://www.google.com

It looks like the href isn't created when we insert a link other than a real link.
fields.summary: Impossible to create a accessible link with the following address: http://XXXXXXXXX/object/objects.aspx?&ot=action&_max=*&_statusx=openclosed&itemtype==CHANGE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23376].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create an Excel spreadsheet and enter some text in a cell
# Select part of that cell and change its formatting (e.g. bold, italics, underline)
# Save this spreadsheet and upload to Confluence
# Rebuild search index

*Error in logs:*
{code}
2011-10-02 14:23:25,893 ERROR [Indexer: 1] [officeconnector.index.excel.ExcelXMLTextExtractor] endDocument expected [ 1 ] entries but read [ 2 ]
 -- referer: http://localhost:5350/admin/search-indexes.action | url: /admin/reindex.action | userName: admin | action: reindex
{code}

An example .xlsx is attached.

Here are the contents of sharedStrings.xml when the .xlsx is unarchived, which appears to contain the relevant data:
{code}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<sst xmlns="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/spreadsheetml/2006/main" count="1" uniqueCount="1">
	<si>
		<r>
			<t>foo</t>
		</r>
		<r>
			<rPr>
				<u/>
				<sz val="10"/>
				<rFont val="Verdana"/>
			</rPr>
			<t>bar</t>
		</r>
		<phoneticPr fontId="1" type="noConversion"/>
	</si>
</sst>
{code}
fields.summary: Mixed formatting in single cell in Excel document causes Confluence indexing errors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-23375].
  {panel}

There should be a way, as an admin that I am able to turn off menu items I don't want users to see.

I am struggling to roll out a Confluence site because my users can see things I don't want them to. I don't need users to see ANYTHING under the tools menu but:

Export to Word
Export to PDF

Yet, there are numerous items under this menu that are irrelevant to a user who is only supposed to be there to read information. What use is:

Attachments
Page History
Restrictions

and so on? All of these are irrelevant to a user who is supposed to be consuming what I create.
fields.summary: Ability to disable menu items
